study_title: Near-corneal plane light exposure in daily life
study_ethics: Ethics Committee Technical University of Munich, 2023-115-S-KK
study_short_description: In this study, we measured light exposure in healthy participants at the near-corneal plane, and captured a variaty of contextual, environmental and behavioural contributors to light exposure patterns using smartphone-based experience sampling.
study_sample: Participants are healthy adults between 18 and 55 years old (n=26; mean age 28±5 years, 14F)

study_group_exclusion: requirement of prescription glasses during the experiment
absent from Tuebingen on first and last experimental days

study_funding_sources: The study was part of the the MeLiDos project. The MeLiDos project (22NRM05 MeLiDos) has received funding from the European Partnership on Metrology, co-financed by the European Union’s Horizon Europe Research and Innovation Programme and by the Participating States.
